file_content.text: [This console has been deactivated.]
Come see for yourself. Our coordinates are in this console. My acolytes would welcome the chance to show off their skills.
Return the Voss to their people. Don't make me destroy you.
This is your last warning.
In front of my adoring young charges? I dare you to try.
You'll show them the true nature of the Sith sooner or later.
They'll turn on you soon.
My acolytes have seen the ways of the Sith. Perhaps you can't accept that they prefer them.
Hiding behind civilians won't save you, Lord Beldiss.
Leave them out of this.
Remember this, Republic. Servants do not make one weak.
This is between you and me, Lord Beldiss. Leave the Voss out of it.
Come on, be reasonable.
These Voss are no longer pathetic, lost misfits. Their training has gone remarkably well.
Enough chatter.
Enough chatter.
Your funeral, my lord.
If you strike me down, the Voss will avenge their fallen benefactor.
Come when convenient. My acolytes and I look forward to your arrival.
Ambassador Jannik? I'm in the Ruined City. There are no Voss here.
I'm afraid Ambassador Jannik's comm signal has been jammed. He won't be joining us.
It's strange; it's almost as if you want the Voss to condemn you.
So far, you've stolen files from Voss installations, freed a condemned criminal and done murder in the ruins of an ancient Voss city. An interesting strategy.
You can't deny the proof, Lord Beldiss.
All to expose you.
There's no need; I've broken no law. The Voss joined me willingly.
We've still got a chance.
What have you shown the Voss? Fear, weakness, desperation. Everything the Republic stands for.
Quit stalling.
I've given these outcasts a purpose. If one Sith can strengthen a failed Mystic, imagine what the Empire can do for Voss.
Access denied.
